metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9949 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Apport before 2.20.4. In apport/ui.py, Apport reads the CrashDB field and it then evaluates the field as Python code if it begins with a "{". This allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary Python code. Donncha O Cearbhaill discovered that the crash file parser in Apport improperly treated the CrashDB field as python code. An attacker could use this to convince a user to open a maliciously crafted crash file and execute arbitrary code with the privileges of that user.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9949` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apport - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
apport-gtk - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
apport-kde - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
apport-noui - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
apport-retrace - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
apport-valgrind - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
dh-apport - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
python-apport - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
python-problem-report - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
python3-apport - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
python3-problem-report - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apport package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4').
